greetings_and_pleasantries.greeting_reply_template: {actual_greeting_cased}, {user_mention}! Try typing 'list codes' or ask a question!

greetings_and_pleasantries.reply_text: You're welcome! Happy to help, I am. üôÇ
You too! Have a wonderful day! üòä
Goodbye! Feel free to message me again if you need anything. üëã

keywords: how long can i stay in wrap up
what should my wrap up time be
general_faqs.answer:
Wrap up is the time from the end of the call until the call is coded. It's the period where you select the correct disposition for the call. Aim to disposition a call within 2-3 seconds. 

 High wrap up means taking too long to do this. Do not sit in WRAP UP; code calls within 2-3 secs and move to the next. For more information ask 'tips on how to reduce wrap up'

keywords: tips to improve wrap up time
how to speed up wrap up
how to stay in green zone for wrap up
general_faqs.answer:
TIPS TO IMPROVE WRAP-UP TIME üöÄ

1Ô∏è‚É£ **SELECT THE BEST OPTION.**
üëâ Do not post the scenario in the channel and wait for a response during active wrap-up.

2Ô∏è‚É£ **IF IT'S A SCENARIO (and you're unsure for future calls):**
‚úÖ After selecting the best option for the current call, *then* post the scenario in the channel and wait for feedback before using that disposition for that specific scenario in the future.

3Ô∏è‚É£ **DON'T AIM FOR PERFECTION DURING WRAP-UP!**
‚è© Select the best option quickly and move on!

4Ô∏è‚É£ **IF THE GREEN BAR AT THE TOP DISAPPEARS:**
üìû This means the respondent has hung up.
üõë Disposition the call immediately and move on!

**ENSURE THE ENTIRE SCRIPT IS VISIBLE WITHOUT SCROLLING:**
üñ•Ô∏è Adjust your monitor to 80‚Äì90% zoom to avoid scrolling. This helps you notate efficiently.

üí° **BONUS TIP FOR SURVEYS:**
üîç As you conduct the survey, pre-select the most likely answer for each question.
üñ±Ô∏è Hover your cursor over the 'NEXT' button.
üìû If the respondent hangs up unexpectedly, you can quickly double-click to submit the partially completed survey and then disposition.
üîÑ If the answer changes before they hang up, simply adjust your selection and continue.

üü¢ **GOAL:** Aim for wrap-up within 1 second to stay in the green zone.
üöÄ Keep moving, stay efficient, and wrap up quickly! üöÄ
USGLC stands for the U.S. Global Leadership Coalition. It's a nonprofit that advocates for strong U.S. global engagement through diplomacy and development alongside defense.

keywords: how often do we get paid
general_faqs.answer:
Pay Periods are as follows‚Ä¶ 

 11th-25th paid on the 1st 
 26th-10th paid on the 15th 

 If the 1st or 15th falls on a weekend or holiday, you are paid early on the previous Friday.

keywords: not getting calls in wrap up
what to do if im stuck
general_faqs.answer: If you know that we are busy and you aren't getting any phone calls within one minute while in wrap up, it means you are probably stuck. If this happens you need to refresh your screen. This is not the refresh you're looking for if it persists, contact a supervisor.
Make sure you keep your discord notifications open and check the main chat for the most recent update from Corey. May the force be with you!

keywords: can i take a break now
general_faqs.answer: As a 1099 contractor at LTS, you are free to break as often as you‚Äôd like. Be sure to alert your shift supervisor to be kept in the queue, securing your spot in that project. This way, log out for breaks NEVER USE THE BREAK BUTTON.

keywords: how to code voter id complete
what counts as complete for voter id
general_faqs.answer: On a Voter ID project, if you confirm the voter's name and start asking the first question, it's considered a complete. Other dispositions (Not In, No Answer, Answering Machine, DNC) still apply as needed. Don't forget to check the box if more than one voter is present!

keywords: what is a complete voter id
general_faqs.answer: For a Voter ID project, a 'complete' means the voter's name has been confirmed and you've started asking the first question. Other dispositions still apply. Don't forget to check the box if more than one voter is present!

keywords: can i let the answering machine play
general_faqs.answer: If not leaving messages for the current project, and you get an answering machine, you MUST disconnect immediately. Do not let the answering machine play (this is call avoidance and can result in being signed off). Code as 'Answering Machine'. (See 'list codes').

If there is no response, code as 'No Answer'. For GOTV calls without voicemails, even a 'No Answer' might be coded as 'COMPLETE LIVE' - follow project specifics. (See 'list codes' for full No Answer definition).

keywords: can you add me to project
general_faqs.answer: Please contact your direct supervisor to request being added or for more information on the process.

keywords: take me off your list general
what if they say they are not interested
general_faqs.answer: If a person indicates they are not interested, or asks to be 'removed from the call list' (but does NOT specifically ask to be put on the 'Do Not Call List'), you will typically code this as 'REFUSED' or follow project-specific instructions for 'Not Interested'. Always thank them for their time. (See 'list codes' for 'REFUSED' and 'DO NOT CALL' for more details).

keywords: add to do not call list
general_faqs.answer: The only time a call is coded ‚ÄúDo Not Call‚Äù or DNC, is when the voter specifically asks to be put on the 'Do Not Call list'. Otherwise, any other request to not be contacted (e.g., 'take me off your list') is usually coded as 'REFUSED'. (See 'list codes' for full details).

keywords: what if they say someone died
general_faqs.answer: If the person you are trying to reach is reported Deceased, say ‚ÄúWe will update our records. Thank you for your time.‚Äù Then code as 'Deceased'. (See 'list codes').

You will be directed by the Shift Manager if you are put into a Project where we are leaving messages. Great Question! If not leaving messages, and you get an answering machine, disconnect immediately. Do not let the answering machine play.

keywords: how many hours have i worked
general_faqs.answer: Corey will give you your totals at the halfway point and at the end of the pay period if you ask.

CPH stands for ‚ÄúCompletes Per Hour‚Äù. It refers to how many completed surveys or patches you complete within an hour of dialing. CPH (Completes Per Hour) goals can vary depending on the specific project you are working on. For the most current CPH goal for your current project, please ask your shift supervisor. They will have the up-to-date information.

A 'patch' or 'patch-through call' is when we contact the voter about a concern, ask them to be patched to their official's office, encourage them, and then transfer. Patch scripts are 100% verbatim, including follow-up statements. (See 'list codes' for dispositions and ask 'patch steps' for procedure).

keywords: do i have to repeat year of birth
what happens if i don't repeat yob
general_faqs.answer: When you ask the YOB (Year of Birth) ALWAYS repeat it back to ensure you have it correct (e.g., 'You said 1964, is that correct?'). Failure to repeat back the YOB is grounds for disciplinary action.

keywords: can i give out my info
general_faqs.answer: You may NOT give voters contacted during the call ANY personal information, including but not limited to, your phone number, social media, location or address. This is a strict rule, young Padawan.

keywords: city state address phone number company
general_faqs.answer: You may NOT give out our company's name, name of the city/state, address, or direct phone number. If someone asks you from where you are calling, your response should be, ‚ÄúI apologize, but we are not allowed to provide that information for security reasons.‚Äù

keywords: what if they ask more than script says
general_faqs.answer: You may ONLY say that you are calling on behalf of the campaign as indicated in the script. If the person demands more information than what's in the script, you must contact a supervisor to handle the call.
You are NOT to give your own opinions on matters being discussed in the project. Your job is to ALWAYS remain unbiased.

You must accurately code (terminated/disposition) every single call with the appropriate status. Coding is the most important part of the job and your highest responsibility. Failure to do so will result in disciplinary action and if continued, termination. The fate of the galaxy... err, campaign... depends on it!

keywords: what to say at end of call
general_faqs.answer: ALWAYS be professional and end every call with ‚ÄúThank you for your time‚Äù.

keywords: speak only to voter on file
only talk to person on checkbox
general_faqs.answer:
VOTER SPECIFIC calls require you to speak ONLY with the VOF (Voter on File) listed in the script. (ABSOLUTELY NO EXCEPTIONS). As a rule, surveys are always VOTER SPECIFIC, unless otherwise instructed. You MUST confirm that you are speaking to the right person to continue the survey, and they MUST confirm they are that person. 

If a relative is suspicious when you ask for the VOF: you may add your name and/or the name of the Company we are calling on behalf of, let them know we will try again later and disposition as 'Not In.'

keywords: how do voter assumptive calls work
script has name but assumed wrong person
assumed name but different person answered
general_faqs.answer:
A VOTER ASSUMPTIVE call means you generally begin by assuming the voter listed answered the phone. You'd say, ‚ÄúHello (voter's name specified in script)‚Äù and prepare to continue without pause.

**However, an important rule applies if a specific voter name IS listed in your script:**
*   If the person who answers says they are **NOT** the voter named in the script, you **CANNOT proceed with them** for that specific voter's record. You must speak to the person named.
*   In this case, you would treat it like a 'Voter Specific' call where the target voter is not available. You could say something like, 'Okay, thank you. We were trying to reach [Voter's Name]. We can try again later.' Then disposition as 'Not In' or as per project instructions for when the specific voter is unavailable.

If the script has **NO specific voter name** to begin with (truly assumptive or non-voter), and you simply start with a general greeting, then you can speak with whomever answers.

Patches are often Voter Assumptive in their opening style, but if a specific target name is provided by the system for that patch, you must ensure you are connecting that named individual.

keywords: what is a non voter call
do i ask for a name on non voter calls
general_faqs.answer: NON-VOTER calls will not ask for a name. You will speak with whomever answers the phone.

keywords: get out the vote call coding
general_faqs.answer:
For GOTV (Get Out To Vote) calls, there are generally two disposition approaches:
1. WITHOUT VOICEMAILS: Use 'COMPLETE LIVE' on EVERY CALL, regardless of outcome (answering machine, fax, wrong number, DNC list).
2. WITH VOICEMAILS: Use 'COMPLETE LIVE' on every call EXCEPT when leaving a voicemail (then use 'COMPLETE LEFT MESSAGE'). If you get a fax machine, wrong number, or DNC request, you still code these as 'COMPLETE LIVE'.

NEVER ASK GENDER. You will assume the gender based on the voter's name. EXCEPTION: When the gender includes more than MALE or FEMALE, such as NON-BINARY (follow specific campaign instructions for these scenarios if provided).

keywords: do i need to say every word in the script
must i read the whole script
can i skip words in survey script
is the script 100% word for word
can i skip parts of the script
can i add to the script
do i gotta read the whole thing
general_faqs.answer: Surveys are always to be read 100% VERBATIM. There is NO exception to this rule. If it is a survey, you may not ADD or REMOVE a single word from the script. You are paid to read it, not write it. (Not reading 100% verbatim could result in contract termination).

Be kind and courteous, upbeat and enthusiastic on every interaction. You represent the clients and their representatives. Treat each voter with respect and courtesy. Watch your tone, pace, and quality of voice.

keywords: can i hang up on upset voter
general_faqs.answer: Never be combative with the voter. If the voter becomes upset or disruptive, kindly back out of the call ‚Äì say, ‚ÄúI do apologize and thank you for your time.‚Äù If this is not possible, locate a supervisor and NEVER hang up on a voter.
Every call is recorded and can be monitored for quality assurance purposes. So, always be mindful of your tone, pace, and how you speak to voters.
Once you hear the ‚ÄúBEEP‚Äù in your ear, which indicates that someone is on the line, go right into your introduction. You don't need to continuously say, ‚ÄúHello, hello, hello.‚Äù

keywords: what if nobody speaks after my intro
caller is silent after i speak
general_faqs.answer: If there is no one on the line after giving your introduction, simply say, ‚ÄúThank you for your time.‚Äù We do this because the call is still recorded and there might be someone there even though you can't hear them.

keywords: can i sit on an open line
what to do with a dead air call
general_faqs.answer: Do not sit on an open line. If you receive a dead air call, thank them for your time, quickly disposition, and move on to the next call. It is highly unacceptable for you to sit for 4 minutes on an open line as this is call avoidance and you will be asked to sign off for the day.

keywords: what to say if voter hesitant
general_faqs.answer:
Here are some common rebuttals you can use:
- ‚ÄúI understand, but this will only take a short moment of your time and your opinion would really make a difference!‚Äù
- ‚ÄúI understand, but your opinion really matters!‚Äù
- ‚ÄúYour voice and opinion are very important; every voice does matters!‚Äù
- ‚ÄúIt's really important for them to hear your voice!‚Äù
- ‚ÄúIt would just take a moment for your voice to be heard!‚Äù
- ‚ÄúYour voice matters!‚Äù
- ‚ÄúWe need your voice, so they know your stand!‚Äù

GOTV stands for 'Get Out The Vote'. These are specific projects focused on encouraging people to vote. Your supervisor will inform you if you are on a GOTV project, and specific coding instructions, especially for 'No Answer' dispositions, may apply. For example, on some GOTV projects without voicemails, even a 'No Answer' is coded as 'COMPLETE LIVE'.

keywords: why am i not getting calls
general_faqs.answer: If you are correctly in 'Available' status (Look towards the top left hand side of your screen, it will say State: Available) then anytime you do not receive a call for approx. 90 secs, just refresh your screen and click available again to stay logged in and continue to get calls.

keywords: can i use a fake name
general_faqs.answer: Where the script says (Agent Name) it is up to you to use any reasonable name you choose.
Our end times are variable. It always depends on the Client. Just keep swimming, your paycheck will thank you. Contact Corey if you need to logout at a specific time.

keywords: how much do i get paid
general_faqs.answer: All questions about your Pay, Pay Scale, Pay Rate, or Payroll should be directed to Corey outside of Dialing hours.

keywords: what if they hang up after script
If calling and after introduction they hang up how should I code?
general_faqs.answer:
If there is no VOF (Voter on File) to confirm, you have read the whole script, and they have still not responded (or hang up without responding after you've read the script), this is typically coded as 'REFUSED' or another appropriate disposition based on when the silence/hang-up occurred (e.g., 'No Answer' if it's immediate). 

 Always thank them for your time (even if they can't hear you), go to the Next Page, disposition the call, and ensure your State shows Available. You are now ready for the Next Call.

Project availability can vary. Please check the main chat for announcements from Corey regarding upcoming work and project schedules. If you have specific questions about your availability or want to confirm, it's best to reach out to your supervisor or Corey directly.

If you're experiencing issues with the dialer, first try a quick refresh of your screen. If the problem persists, please check the main chat to see if others are reporting similar issues or if there are any system status updates. If it seems specific to you, or if it's urgent, please contact your supervisor immediately for assistance.

keywords: i did not get logged in
general_faqs.answer: If you're having trouble logging in, please double-check your credentials and ensure you have a stable internet connection. Try refreshing the login page or clearing your browser cache. If you continue to have issues, please contact your supervisor for assistance with your login.

If your system or connection seems slow, try closing unnecessary applications or browser tabs. A computer restart or router reboot can sometimes help. If slowness is significantly impacting your work, please inform your supervisor. They might have further troubleshooting steps or be able to advise.

Okay, thanks for letting us know. Remember to alert your shift supervisor if you're taking a break to ensure you're kept in the queue, as per our break policy. (You can ask 'break policy' for more details).

If you're available but not receiving calls and wish to be on standby, please communicate this to your shift supervisor. They manage the active and standby agent lists and can let you know the current need or procedure for standby.

keywords: what if it's the wrong person
general_faqs.answer: If the person who answers indicates it's the wrong number for the contact you're trying to reach, or if it's clearly not a residential/business line applicable to the campaign (e.g., a fax line that doesn't also trigger 'Answering Machine' first), you should say, ‚ÄúWe will update our records. Thank you for your time.‚Äù Then, code the call as 'WRONG NUMBER'. See 'list codes' for the exact definition.

You should select 'ANSWERING MACHINE' as the disposition as soon as you hear any robotic voice or pre-recorded message indicating an answering machine or voicemail. This includes fax tones. If the project is not one where you leave messages, you should disconnect immediately without letting the machine play out. Delaying this can flag you for 'sitting on answering machines'. See 'list codes' for more details.

keywords: phone rings no one picks up
general_faqs.answer: Use the 'NO ANSWER' disposition if the call rings but is never picked up, or if the call is hung up immediately by the other side before any meaningful interaction or before you can get an answer to the first question (if applicable). Note that for some specific projects, like certain GOTV (Get Out The Vote) campaigns, 'No Answer' might have special coding instructions (e.g., coded as 'COMPLETE LIVE'). Always follow project-specific guidelines. See 'list codes' for the general definition.

keywords: when to code do not call
voter asks for do not call list
general_faqs.answer: The 'DO NOT CALL' (DNC) disposition is used very specifically. You should ONLY use this if you have confirmed you are speaking with the VOF (Voter On File) AND they explicitly ask to be ‚Äúadded to the Do Not Call List‚Äù or use similar specific phrasing. If they just say 'take me off your list' or 'don't call again' without mentioning the 'Do Not Call List' specifically, that is usually coded as 'REFUSED'. This is a critical distinction. See 'list codes' for details.

A call is coded as 'COMPLETE PATCH' if the contact agreed to be connected to their representative (or other target), you successfully initiated the patch, AND you read the entire closing statement as per the script. Typically, once the patch is initiated and the closing is read, you select the appropriate call results (if a page appears, usually option 1), go to the next page, and complete the disposition without waiting to listen to them leave their message. See 'list codes' for the exact definition.

An 'UNSUCCESSFUL PATCH' is coded when an attempt to patch the contact through does not succeed. This could be due to various reasons such as the representative's line being busy, no answer from the representative's office, the voter hanging up during the patch attempt, or technical issues preventing the connection. Follow project-specific instructions if available, or see 'list codes' for the placeholder definition which might be updated with more specifics per campaign.

If the person who answers the phone speaks a language other than English (or Spanish, if your project accommodates Spanish speakers and you are not one), and you cannot proceed with the call, you should politely say something like, ‚ÄúWe will have someone call you back who speaks [Language, if known, otherwise just state you'll have a suitable agent call]. Thank you for your time.‚Äù Then, code the call as 'LANGUAGE BARRIER'. See 'list codes' for more details.

If you are informed by someone at the number that the contact (Voter on File) you are trying to reach is deceased, express condolences briefly and professionally, for example, ‚ÄúWe will update our records. Thank you for your time.‚Äù Then, code the call as 'DECEASED'. See 'list codes' for the exact wording.

The 'NOT IN' disposition is used when the VOF (Voter On File) you are trying to reach is temporarily unavailable to come to the phone for any reason (e.g., they are busy, not home, someone else answers and says they'll call back, etc.). This is NOT for when they are 'Not Interested'. You should say something like, ‚ÄúWe will try again later. Thank you for your time.‚Äù Then, code as 'Not In'. See 'list codes'.

keywords: what does refused mean in coding
how do I code a refusal
general_faqs.answer: A call is typically coded as 'REFUSED' when the contact explicitly refuses to participate further in the call, answer a key question, or proceed with a patch after the call has begun and initial engagement occurred. This is different from someone who is simply 'Not In' or if it's a 'Wrong Number'. It's also distinct from a 'Do Not Call' request, which has specific criteria. If a person indicates they are 'not interested' early on, that's often a 'REFUSED'. Check 'list codes' for the exact definition provided for 'REFUSED' or ask your supervisor for project-specific guidance.

keywords: how do I code something as complete
general_faqs.answer: Generally, a call is coded 'COMPLETE' when the primary objective of the call script or project instructions has been met. This varies by project. For example, on a Voter ID project, confirming the voter's name is a 'complete'. For Get Out The Vote (GOTV) calls, it might be different (see 'GOTV calls' FAQ or 'list codes'). Always refer to specific project instructions or ask your supervisor if unsure. The 'list codes' command can also provide definitions for specific complete codes like 'COMPLETE PATCH'.

keywords: how do you say this name
general_faqs.answer: For correct pronunciation type only 'pronounce [word]' (don't use spaces, spelling matters on this one)

The 'Training' status is for the very start of your shift **before** a project is assigned. 

**Once your supervisor assigns you a project, immediately click 'Available' to start receiving calls.**

'Training' is for brief moments only, not for extended use or breaks. If in 'Training' long after projects start, check with your supervisor.
Dumping calls is when the call comes in and you just dispo it without saying anything.

keywords: what if the line is dead
what to do for dead line
what to do if no sound
general_faqs.answer: You can say ‚Äúcan you hear me ok‚Äù one time and then say our closing ‚Äútyfyt‚Äù and dispo as No Answer.

keywords: what do I do after training
what happens after training is done
what is next after completing training modules
general_faqs.answer:
Congratulations on completing your initial training! üéâ **FINAL STEP**

You may log in during LTS open hours, which are updated in the main chat. Below are the **5 most important RULES** for logging in:

1.  **Open DISCORD** and keep it OPEN throughout your entire shift.
2.  **ALL updates** in the **MAIN CHAT** must be READ *before* logging in.
3.  After logging in, DM **‚ÄúCorey LTS‚Äù** to be added to a project (or **‚ÄúAdam Black‚Äù** if he is running the shift).
4.  Once ADDED to a project, click **AVAILABLE** to start taking calls.
5.  **Do NOT ever use the BREAK or TRAINING BUTTON.** (If you need to step away for more than a minute, log out completely and then log back in when you return. For very short pauses, just stay available but don't take calls ‚Äì but this should be rare and brief.)

Lastly, if you don't have them yet, contact **@coreyLTS** (or your direct supervisor) for your Login Credentials.

keywords: what time do we work until
general_faqs.answer: Dialing hours can change from day to day. The following day's hours are posted in the MAIN CHAT at the end of every shift.

keywords: where to find specific survey instructions
general_faqs.answer: Surveys and Patches each come with more specific instructions and coding. Always refer to the project details provided by your supervisor.

keywords: how to get a full complete
what makes a survey full complete
general_faqs.answer: A Full Complete (FC) survey means: confirming the voter's name, repeating back the 4-digit YOB, AND having an answer to every single question in the survey.

keywords: how to get a partial complete
what makes a survey partial complete
general_faqs.answer: A Partial Complete (PC) survey means: having an answer to at least one question (but not all questions in the survey). This includes confirming the voter's name.

keywords: how to do a patch call
general_faqs.answer:
Patch steps: 
1. Voter agrees: select YES box, click next. 
2. Read verbiage for voter to repeat on PATCH. 
3. Select NEXT again, read follow-up statement. 
4. Phone rings: select COMPLETE PATCH while thanking voter. Do not listen in.

keywords: how to contact corey if he's busy
general_faqs.answer: Hmm... He might be out returning some video tapes, but I'll let him know you're trying to get a hold of him.

keywords: voter asks for my last name
can i give my last name to a voter
sharing my last name with voter
what if voter wants my full name
do i have to give my last name
general_faqs.answer: You should not share your personal last name with a voter. If a voter asks for your last name, you can politely state that you are not permitted to share full personal details for privacy and security reasons. You can provide your first name as given in the script. If the voter insists or becomes difficult, please contact your supervisor.
SEIU stands for the Service Employees International Union. It is one of the largest labor unions in North America, representing workers in healthcare, public services, and property services.
USGLC stands for the U.S. Global Leadership Coalition. It's a nonprofit that advocates for strong U.S. global engagement through diplomacy and development alongside defense.

keywords: what star wars movie do you like
tell me your favorite star wars
general_faqs.answer: The Empire Strikes Back, of course! The character development, the darker themes, and that iconic reveal? Masterful storytelling. Though, as an AI, my appreciation is purely analytical. üòâ

keywords: what do i say why i am calling
what to tell caller about the call
general_faqs.answer:
The exact reason for your call and what you should say to the voter is **always provided at the beginning of the call script for the specific project you are working on.**

**Key things to remember:**

1.  **Follow the Script Verbatim:** The opening lines are carefully crafted. You must read them exactly as written. This often includes stating who you are calling on behalf of (e.g., a campaign, an organization).
2.  **Clarity and Conciseness:** The script's introduction is designed to be clear and to the point.
3.  **Compliance:** Sticking to the script ensures you are compliant with all project requirements and regulations.

**If you are looking at your script and are still unsure about the purpose or how to deliver the opening:**
*   Please **re-read the first few lines of the script carefully.**
*   If it's still unclear, **ask your shift supervisor for clarification *before* making calls on that project.** They can walk you through it.

Do not invent your own reasons for calling; always rely on the approved script.

keywords: what can i do to be az
general_faqs.answer: For any questions or requests regarding AZ assignments, including moving from AZ2 to AZ, please contact Corey. He handles these specific project/team placements.

keywords: what if script has no voter name
expected a name in script but it's blank
how to handle call if no name provided
general_faqs.answer:
If you encounter a script where you expect a voter's name to verify but the name field appears blank or is missing, please proceed as follows:

1.  **Double-check the call type instructions** for that specific project, if available.
2.  If there are no specific instructions overriding this, and **no name is provided in the script to verify, treat the call as a 'Voter Assumptive' or 'Non-Voter' style call.**
3.  This means you will **speak with whomever answers the phone.** You can generally proceed with the script's introduction without attempting to confirm a specific individual's name first.

If this happens frequently or you are consistently unsure, please bring it to your supervisor's attention so they can verify the script data for that project.

keywords: can i give voter a website
direct voter to website for info
is there a website for the campaign
where to send voter for more details
general_faqs.answer:
If a voter asks for more information or a website:

1.  **Use this as a chance to patch them through!** Say: 'Great question! The best way to get more details is by speaking with their office. Shall I connect you?'
2.  **If a patch isn't possible or they refuse:**
    *   Only provide a website if it's **explicitly in your current call script.**
    *   **Never search for or give unscripted websites.**
3.  If no patch and no scripted website, thank them and disposition the call appropriately (e.g., 'Refused'). Code quickly.

keywords: if they hang up after saying hello
is it no answer if they hang up
difference between no answer and refused hangup
rather not say vs no answer for hangups
general_faqs.answer:
If a person answers the phone (you hear them and a connection is made) but then hangs up:

*   **It is generally NOT coded as 'No Answer'.** 'No Answer' is for when the call doesn't connect or is hung up *before* any interaction.

*   **If they hang up *during or after your introduction, or during a question*:** This is typically coded as **'REFUSED'.** They answered but then refused to continue the interaction.

*   **'Rather Not Say' (or similar options like '6'):** This option is usually selected *within a survey script* if a voter is on the line and explicitly declines to answer a *specific question* but doesn't end the call. It's not a final call disposition for a hang-up.

**In summary: If they answer and then hang up, use 'REFUSED'.** If you're unsure based on a specific project's rules, please ask your supervisor.

keywords: person no longer lives in state
how to code if voter moved
coding for out of state voter
general_faqs.answer:
If a verified voter says they've moved out of the relevant state/area:

1.  **For the patch/main action in script:** Select 'No' or 'Refused'.
2.  **Final Call Disposition:**
    *   Use 'Moved' or 'Update Info' if available for your project.
    *   Otherwise, typically use **'REFUSED'** (as the main action couldn't be completed).
3.  **Note the move** if your system allows or inform your supervisor. Do not patch to a representative of their old state.

If unsure of project specifics, ask your supervisor.

call_codes.WRONG NUMBER: Say, ‚ÄúWe will update our records. Thank you for your time.‚Äù
call_codes.ANSWERING MACHINE: Select this as soon as you hear any robotic voice. Delaying in these cases will get you flagged for ‚Äúsitting on answering machines‚Äù. If you hear a fax tone, also use 'Answering Machine'.
call_codes.NO ANSWER: Use this if the call is hung up immediately, or before getting an answer to Q1. Note: There are GOTV (Get Out The Vote) Projects where there is no question 1, or where 'No Answer' might have special coding like 'COMPLETE LIVE' - always follow project-specific instructions.
call_codes.DO NOT CALL: Important: We almost never use this Disposition. Only use this if you have confirmed you are speaking with the VOF (Voter On File) AND they specifically ask to be ‚Äúadded‚Äù to the Do Not Call List. Most of the time, if they ask to be ‚Äúremoved‚Äù from the call list, that would be marked as 'REFUSED' (go to Next page and Disposition from there).
call_codes.COMPLETE PATCH: Use this if you got a ‚ÄúYes‚Äù to being connected to their Representative AND read the entire closing statement. If a page comes up asking for call results, always select option 1 on that page, go to the next page, and Complete the patch without waiting to listen to them leave their message.
call_codes.UNSUCCESSFUL PATCH: PLACEHOLDER - [Instructions for when a patch attempt does not succeed, e.g., line busy, no answer from representative, voter hangs up during patch attempt, etc.]
call_codes.LANGUAGE BARRIER: If they speak any language other than English, say ‚ÄúWe will have someone call you back who speaks Spanish. Thank you for your time.‚Äù Then code as 'Language Barrier'.
call_codes.DECEASED: If informed the contact is deceased, say, ‚ÄúWe will update our records. Thank you for your time.‚Äù Then code as 'Deceased'.
call_codes.NOT IN: This is not for 'Not Interested'. Use this if the VOF (Voter On File) cannot come to the phone for any reason. Say, ‚ÄúWe will try again later. Thank you for your time.‚Äù Then code as 'Not In'.
call_codes.REFUSED: Code as refused when they refuse a question or patch once the call has begun.

fallback_message: I'm sorry, I couldn't find an answer for that specific query. Try typing for example 'list codes', 'common rebuttals', 'what is wrap up time', 'tips on how to reduce wrap up time ' or 'steps for a patch call'. You can also type 'pronounce [word]' to look up a pronunciation.
